AddDBInstanceToReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to add a read-only replica to an RO group.
AddDBInstanceToReadOnlyGroup.name: Adds a read-only replica to an RO group

CloneDBInstance.document: This API is used to clone an instance by specifying a backup set or a point in time.
CloneDBInstance.name: Clones an instance

CloseDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable the public network address of an instance.
CloseDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables the public network address of an instance

CloseServerlessDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable the public network address of a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance.
CloseServerlessDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables the public network address of a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance

CreateBaseBackup.document: This API is used to create a data backup of an instance.
CreateBaseBackup.name: Creates a data backup for an instance

CreateDBInstanceNetworkAccess.document: This API is used to create a network for an instance.
CreateDBInstanceNetworkAccess.name: Creates a network for an instance

CreateDBInstances.document: This API is used to create (but not initialize) one or more TencentDB for PostgreSQL instances. This API is disused and replaced by the [CreateInstances](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/409/56107?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
CreateDBInstances.name: (Disused) Creates an instance

CreateInstances.document:
This API is used to create one or more PostgreSQL instances. Instances created through this interface do not need to be initialized and can be used directly.
  • After an instance is successfully created, it will automatically start up, and its status changes to "Running".
  • For prepaid instances, the required amount for the instance purchase will be deducted in advance. For post-paid hourly instances, the amount required for the purchase within the first hour will be temporarily frozen. Please ensure that your account balance is sufficient before calling this interface.
CreateInstances.name: Creates an instance

CreateParameterTemplate.document: This API is used to create a parameter template.
CreateParameterTemplate.name: Creates a parameter template

CreateReadOnlyDBInstance.document: This API is used to create read-only replicas.
CreateReadOnlyDBInstance.name: Creates read-only replicas

CreateReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to create an RO group.
CreateReadOnlyGroup.name: Creates an RO group

CreateReadOnlyGroupNetworkAccess.document: This API is used to create a network for an RO group.
CreateReadOnlyGroupNetworkAccess.name: Creates a network for an RO group

CreateServerlessDBInstance.document: This API is used to create a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance. If the creation succeeds, the instance ID will be returned.
CreateServerlessDBInstance.name: Creates a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance

DeleteBaseBackup.document: This API is used to delete a specified data backup for an instance.
DeleteBaseBackup.name: Deletes a data backup for an instance

DeleteDBInstanceNetworkAccess.document: This API is used to delete a network of an instance.
DeleteDBInstanceNetworkAccess.name: Deletes a network of an instance

DeleteLogBackup.document: This API is used to delete the specified log backup of an instance.
DeleteLogBackup.name: Deletes a log backup of an instance

DeleteParameterTemplate.document: This API is used to delete a parameter template.
DeleteParameterTemplate.name: Deletes a parameter template

DeleteReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to delete an RO group.
DeleteReadOnlyGroup.name: Deletes an RO group

DeleteReadOnlyGroupNetworkAccess.document: This API is used to delete a network of an RO group.
DeleteReadOnlyGroupNetworkAccess.name: Deletes a network of an RO group

DeleteServerlessDBInstance.document: This API is used to delete a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance.
DeleteServerlessDBInstance.name: Deletes a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to query the list of the database accounts for an instance.
DescribeAccounts.name: Queries the list of the database accounts for an instance

DescribeAvailableRecoveryTime.document: This API is used to query the available restoration time of an instance.
DescribeAvailableRecoveryTime.name: Queries the available restoration time of an instance

DescribeBackupDownloadRestriction.document: This API is used to query the backup download restrictions.
DescribeBackupDownloadRestriction.name: Queries the backup download restrictions

DescribeBackupDownloadURL.document: u200cThis API is used to query the download address of a specified backup set, including full backup sets and incremental log backup sets.
DescribeBackupDownloadURL.name: Queries the download address of a backup set

DescribeBackupOverview.document: This API is used to query the backup overview. It will return the current number and size of backups, free backup space size, and paid backup space size (all size values are in bytes).
DescribeBackupOverview.name: Queries the backup overview

DescribeBackupPlans.document: This API is used to query all backup plans of an instance.
DescribeBackupPlans.name: Queries backup plans

DescribeBackupSummaries.document: This API is used to query the backup statistics of an instance. It will return the number and size (bytes) of backups of the instance.
DescribeBackupSummaries.name: Queries the backup statistics

DescribeBaseBackups.document: This API is used to query the list of data backups.
DescribeBaseBackups.name: Queries the list of data backups

DescribeClasses.document: This API is used to query purchasable instance specifications.
DescribeClasses.name: Queries purchasable specifications

DescribeCloneDBInstanceSpec.document: This API is used to query the minimum specification required by a cloned instance, including `SpecCode` and disk specification.
DescribeCloneDBInstanceSpec.name: Queries the purchasable specification of a clone instance

DescribeDBBackups.document: This API is used to query the backup list of an instance. This API is disused and replaced by the [DescribeBaseBackups](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/409/89022?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
DescribeDBBackups.name: (Disused) Queries u200cthe backup list of an instance

DescribeDBErrlogs.document: This API is used to query an error log.
DescribeDBErrlogs.name: Queries an error log

DescribeDBInstanceAttribute.document: This API is used to query the details of one instance.
DescribeDBInstanceAttribute.name: Queries instance details

DescribeDBInstanceHAConfig.document:
This API is used to query the HA configuration of an instance, which includes:
<li>Allow a standby node to promote to a primary node.
<li>Allow a semi-sync instance to adopt sync or async replication.
DescribeDBInstanceHAConfig.name: Queries the HA configuration of an instance

DescribeDBInstanceParameters.document: This API is used to query the parameters of an instance.
DescribeDBInstanceParameters.name: Queries the parameters of an instance

DescribeDBInstanceSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group of an instance.
DescribeDBInstanceSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group of an instance

DescribeDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the details of one or more instances.
DescribeDBInstances.name: Queries instance list

DescribeDBSlowlogs.document: This API is used to get a slow query log. Since it was deprecated on September 1, 2021, it has no longer returned data. You need to use the [DescribeSlowQueryList](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/409/60540?from_cn_redirect=1) API instead to get slow query logs.
DescribeDBSlowlogs.name: Gets slow query logs (deprecated)

DescribeDBVersions.document: This API is used to query the list of supported database versions.
DescribeDBVersions.name: Queries the list of supported database versions

DescribeDBXlogs.document: This API is used to get the instance Xlog list. This API is disused and replaced by the [DescribeBaseBackups](https://www.tencentcloud.com/zh/document/product/409/54343) API.
DescribeDBXlogs.name: (Disused) Gets the instance Xlog list

DescribeDatabases.document: This API is used to query the database list of an instance.
DescribeDatabases.name: Queries the database list of an instance

DescribeDefaultParameters.document: This API is used to query all parameters supported by a database version and engine.
DescribeDefaultParameters.name: Queries the list of default parameters

DescribeEncryptionKeys.document: This API is used to query the instance key list.
DescribeEncryptionKeys.name: Queries the instance key list

DescribeLogBackups.document: This API is used to query the list of log backups.
DescribeLogBackups.name: Queries the list of log backups

DescribeOrders.document: This API is used to query the order information.
DescribeOrders.name: Queries the order information

DescribeParameterTemplateAttributes.document: This API is used to query the details of a parameter template, including basic information and parameter information.
DescribeParameterTemplateAttributes.name: Queries the details of a parameter template

DescribeParameterTemplates.document: This API is used to query the list of parameter templates.
DescribeParameterTemplates.name: Queries the list of parameter templates

DescribeParamsEvent.document: This API is used to query the parameter modification event.
DescribeParamsEvent.name: Queries the parameter modification event

DescribeProductConfig.document: This API is used to query the purchasable specification configuration. u200cThis API is disused and replaced by the [DescribeClasses](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/409/89019?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
DescribeProductConfig.name: (Disused) Queries purchasable specification configuration

DescribeReadOnlyGroups.document: This API is used to query the list of RO groups.
DescribeReadOnlyGroups.name: Queries the list of RO groups

DescribeRegions.document: This API is used to query the purchasable regions.
DescribeRegions.name: Queries purchasable regions

DescribeServerlessDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the details of one or more PostgreSQL for Serverless instances.
DescribeServerlessDBInstances.name: Queries the list of PostgreSQL for Serverless instances

DescribeSlowQueryAnalysis.document: This API is used to count and analyze slow query statements during the specified period of time and return aggregated statistical analysis results which are classified by statement with abstract parameter values.
DescribeSlowQueryAnalysis.name: Gets the statistical analysis list of slow queries

DescribeSlowQueryList.document: This API is used to get the slow queries during the specified period of time.
DescribeSlowQueryList.name: Gets the slow query list

DescribeZones.document: This API is used to query the supported AZs.
DescribeZones.name: Queries purchasable AZs

DestroyDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate an isolated instance by specifying the `DBInstanceId` parameter. The data of a terminated instance will be deleted and cannot be recovered. Be cautious with this API calling. Only the instance in isolation can be terminated.
DestroyDBInstance.name: Terminates an instance

DisIsolateDBInstances.document: This API is used to remove one or more instances from isolation.
DisIsolateDBInstances.name: Removes instances from isolation

InitDBInstances.document: This API is used to initialize a TencentDB for PostgreSQL instance. This API is disused and replaced by the [CreateInstances](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/409/56107?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
InitDBInstances.name: (Disused) Initializes an instance

InquiryPriceCreateDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the purchase price of an instance.
InquiryPriceCreateDBInstances.name: Queries the purchase price of an instance

InquiryPriceRenewDBInstance.document: This API is used to query the renewal price of an instance.
InquiryPriceRenewDBInstance.name: Queries the renewal price of instance

InquiryPriceUpgradeDBInstance.document: This API is used to query the fees of upgrading a specified database instance. Only pay-as-you-go instance is supported.
InquiryPriceUpgradeDBInstance.name: Queries the upgrade price of instance

IsolateDBInstances.document: This API is used to isolate an instance.
IsolateDBInstances.name: Isolates instances

ModifyAccountRemark.document: This API is used to modify account remarks.
ModifyAccountRemark.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyBackupDownloadRestriction.document: This API is used to modify the backup download restrictions.
ModifyBackupDownloadRestriction.name: Modifies the backup download restrictions

ModifyBackupPlan.document: This API is used to modify the backup plan of an instance, such as modifying the backup start time. By default, a full backup starts at midnight every day and the generated backup files will be retained for seven days.
ModifyBackupPlan.name: Modifies a backup plan

ModifyBaseBackupExpireTime.document: This API is used to modify the expiration time of a specified data backup for an instance.
ModifyBaseBackupExpireTime.name: Modifies the expiration time of a data backup

ModifyDBInstanceChargeType.document: This API is used to switch the instance billing mode from pay-as-you-go to monthly subscription.
ModifyDBInstanceChargeType.name: Modifies the instance billing mode

ModifyDBInstanceDeployment.document: This API is used to modify the AZs where the nodes of a source instance reside.
ModifyDBInstanceDeployment.name: Modifies the instance deployment mode

ModifyDBInstanceHAConfig.document:
This API is used to modify the HA configuration of an instance. which includes:
<li>Allow the standby node to promote to the primary node.
<li>Allow a semi-sync instance to adopt sync or async replication.
ModifyDBInstanceHAConfig.name: Modifies the HA configuration of an instance

ModifyDBInstanceName.document: This API is used to rename a TencentDB for PostgreSQL instance.
ModifyDBInstanceName.name: Renames instance

ModifyDBInstanceParameters.document: This API is used to modify instance parameters.
ModifyDBInstanceParameters.name: Modifies instance parameters

ModifyDBInstanceReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to modify the RO group of an instance.
ModifyDBInstanceReadOnlyGroup.name: Modifies the RO group of an instance

ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to modify the security group of an instance.
ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.name: Modifies the security group of an instance

ModifyDBInstanceSpec.document: This API is used to modify instance specifications, including memory and disk size.
ModifyDBInstanceSpec.name: Modifies instance specifications

ModifyDBInstancesProject.document: This API is used to modify the project of an instance.
ModifyDBInstancesProject.name: Modifies the project of an instance

ModifyParameterTemplate.document: This API is used to modify the configurations, such as parameter template name and description. It can also be used to manage the parameter list in the parameter template.
ModifyParameterTemplate.name: Modifies a parameter template

ModifyReadOnlyGroupConfig.document: This API is used to modify RO group configuration.
ModifyReadOnlyGroupConfig.name: Modifies RO group configuration

ModifySwitchTimePeriod.document: This API is used to perform a primary-standby switch for an instance waiting for the switch after it is upgraded.
ModifySwitchTimePeriod.name: Modifies the switch time after configuration upgrade

OpenDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to enable the public network access of an instance.
OpenDBExtranetAccess.name: Enables the public network access of an instance

OpenServerlessDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to enable the public network address of a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance.
OpenServerlessDBExtranetAccess.name: Enables the public network address of a PostgreSQL for Serverless instance

RebalanceReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to rebalance the loads of read-only replicas in an RO group. Please note that connections to those read-only replicas will be interrupted transiently; therefore, you should ensure that your application can reconnect to the databases. This operation should be performed with caution.
RebalanceReadOnlyGroup.name: Rebalances the loads of read-only replicas in an RO group

RemoveDBInstanceFromReadOnlyGroup.document: This API is used to remove a read-only replica from an RO group.
RemoveDBInstanceFromReadOnlyGroup.name: Removes a read-only replica from an RO group

RenewInstance.document: This API is used to renew an instance.
RenewInstance.name: Renews instance

ResetAccountPassword.document: This API is used to reset the account password of an instance.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

RestartDBInstance.document: This API is used to restart an instance.
RestartDBInstance.name: Restarts instance

RestoreDBInstanceObjects.document: This API is used to recover database-related objects such as databases and tables on the original instance based on the backup set or recovery target time.
RestoreDBInstanceObjects.name: Recovers database objects

SetAutoRenewFlag.document: This API is used to set auto-renewal.
SetAutoRenewFlag.name: Sets auto-renewal

SwitchDBInstancePrimary.document:
This API is used to enable the primary-standby switch of an instance.
<li>By initiating a switch, you can verify whether the primary-standby switch is performed correctly.
<li>By using forced switch, you can forcibly initiate the primary-standby switch when the delay of replica node failed to meet the switch requirement.
<li>This operation can only be performed for the primary instance.
SwitchDBInstancePrimary.name: Enables the primary-standby switch of an instance

UpgradeDBInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade instance configurations. u200cThis API is disused and replaced by the [ModifyDBInstanceSpec](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/409/63689?from_cn_redirect=1) API.
UpgradeDBInstance.name: Upgrades instance configuration (deprecated)

UpgradeDBInstanceKernelVersion.document: This API is used to upgrade the kernel version of an instance.
UpgradeDBInstanceKernelVersion.name: Upgrades the kernel version of an instance

UpgradeDBInstanceMajorVersion.document: This API is used to upgrade the major kernel version of an instance, for example, from PostgreSQL 12 to PostgreSQL 15.
UpgradeDBInstanceMajorVersion.name: Upgrades the kernel major version of an instance

members.document:
Username of the instance root account, with the following specifications:
  • The username must consist of 1-16 characters, which can be letters, digits, or underscores.
  • It cannot be postgres.
  • It cannot start with digits or 'pg_'.
  • All rules are case-insensitive.
members.name: AdminName

members.document:
Password for the instance root account username, with a length of 8-32 characters. It is recommended to use a password of more than 12 characters and it cannot start with "/". It must include the following four types of characters:
  • Lowercase letters: [a ~ z]
  • Uppercase letters: [A ~ Z]
  • Digits: 0-9
  • Special symbols: ()`~!@#$%^&*-+=_|{}[]:;'<>,.?/
members.name: AdminPassword

members.document:
Primary-standby sync mode. Valid values:
<li>`Semi-sync`
<li>`Async`
members.name: SyncMode

members.document:
Maximum data lag for high-availability standby server. The standby node can be promoted to the primary node when its data lag and the delay time are both less than the value of `MaxStandbyLatency` and `MaxStandbyLag` respectively.
<li>Unit: byte
<li>Value range: 1073741824-322122547200
members.name: MaxStandbyLatency

members.document:
The maximum delay for high-availability standby server The standby node can be promoted to the primary node when its data lag and the delay time are both less than or equals to the value of `MaxStandbyLatency` and `MaxStandbyLag` respectively.
<li>Unit: s
<li>Value range: 5-10
members.name: MaxStandbyLag

members.document:
Maximum data sync lag for standby server. If data lag of the standby node and the delay time are both less than or equals to the values of `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and `MaxSyncStandbyLag` respectively, the standby server adopts semi-sync replication; if not, it adopts async replication.
This value is only valid for the instance with `SyncMode` set to `Semi-sync`.
This field returns null for async instance
and semi-sync (non-downgradable to async) instance.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: MaxSyncStandbyLatency

members.document:
Maximum sync delay time for standby server. If the delay time for standby server and the data lag are both less than or equals to the values of `MaxSyncStandbyLag` and `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` respectively, the standby server adopts sync replication mode; if not, it adopts async replication.
This value is only valid for the instance with `SyncMode` set to `Semi-sync`.
This field will not return for async instance
and semi-sync (non-downgradable to async) instance.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: MaxSyncStandbyLag

members.document:
Primary-standby sync mode. Valid values:
<li>`Semi-sync`
<li>`Async`
members.name: SyncMode

members.document:
Maximum data lag for high-availability standby server. The standby node can be promoted to the primary node when its data lag and the delay time are both less than the value of `MaxStandbyLatency` and `MaxStandbyLag` respectively.
<li>Unit: byte
<li>Value range: 1073741824-322122547200
members.name: MaxStandbyLatency

members.document:
The maximum delay for high-availability standby server The standby node can be promoted to the primary node when its data lag and the delay time are both less or equals to the value of `MaxStandbyLatency` and `MaxStandbyLag` respectively.
<li>Unit: s
<li>Value range: 5-10
members.name: MaxStandbyLag

members.document:
Maximum data sync lag for standby server. If data lag of the standby node and the delay ime are both less than or equals to the values of `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and `MaxSyncStandbyLag`, the standby server adopts semi-sync replication; if not, it adopts async replication.
This value is only valid for the instance with `SyncMode` set to `Semi-sync`.
When the semi-sync replication mode of the instance is not allowed to downgrade to async replication, `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and `MaxSyncStandbyLag` are not required.
When the semi-sync instance is allowed to downgrade to async replication, `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` is required and `MaxSyncStandbyLag` must be left empty for PostgreSQL 9; `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and MaxSyncStandbyLag` are required for PostgreSQL 10 and later.
members.name: MaxSyncStandbyLatency

members.document:
Maximum delay for sync standby server. If the delay time for standby server and the data lag are both less than or equals to the value of `MaxSyncStandbyLag` and `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` respectively, the standby server adopts sync replication mode; if not, it adopts async replication.
This value is only valid for the instance with `SyncMode` set to `Semi-sync`.
When the semi-sync replication mode of the instance is not allowed to downgrade to async replication, `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and `MaxSyncStandbyLag` are not required.
When the semi-sync instance is allowed to downgrade to async replication, `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` is required and `MaxSyncStandbyLag` must be left empty for PostgreSQL 9; `MaxSyncStandbyLatency` and MaxSyncStandbyLag` are required for PostgreSQL 10 and later.
members.name: MaxSyncStandbyLag

Whether to perform forced switch. As long as the standby node can be accessed, the switch will be performed regardless of the primary-standby sync delay. You can switch immediately only when `SwitchTag` is `0.

members.document:
Switch time for the specified instance after configuration modification.
<li>`0`: Switch now. 
<li>`1`: Switch at the specified time.
<li>`2`: Switch in the maintenance time.
<li>Default value: `0`.
members.name: SwitchTag

members.document: The earliest time to start a switch in the format of "HH:MM:SS", such as "01:00:00". This parameter is invalid when `SwitchTag` is `0` or `2`.
members.name: SwitchStartTime

members.document: The latest time to start a switch in the format of "HH:MM:SS", such as "01:30:00". This parameter is invalid when `SwitchTag` is `0` or `2`. The difference between `SwitchStartTime` and `SwitchEndTime` cannot be less than 30 minutes.

members.document:
Whether to perform a pre-check on the current operation of upgrading the instance kernel version. Valid values:
u200c<li>u200c`true`: Performs a pre-check without upgrading the kernel version. Check items include request parameters, kernel version compatibility, and instance parameters.
u200cu200c<li>`false`: Sends a normal request and upgrades the kernel version directly after the check is passed.
Default value: `false`.
members.name: DryRun

members.document: Pre-upgrade backup option: True means a full backup is required before upgrade, and False means a full backup is not required before upgrade. If there is an existing backup set that can restore the instance to its pre-upgrade state, False can be selected; otherwise, True should be specified. This parameter is invalid when UpgradeCheck is True.
